lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.

Your grade on your last Science test was terrible! Today, after school, Mr. Hinckley is offering a help session to those who did poorly. Your dilemma: Should you go for the help session, or to an after-school party at your friend's house?
Mr. Hinckley is ten minutes late. Will you:
As it turns out, Mr. Hinckley is a bit of a flake. He forgot all about the help session he offered and went home right after school. You can go to the party, after all.
As you are about to leave, you see Mr. Hinckley coming down the hall. Will you:

I thought you were really going to stick it out there for awhile, but you let your impulses get the better of you again. You have a great time at the party, and you get credit for trying to stay after class, besides!

Fortunately, you are pretty smart, so you are able to catch up with your work with no trouble. This is one time in life where you are able to have your cake and eat it, too. Savor it -- it doesn't happen often.
Mr. Hinckley apologizes for being late and gives you a personal study session.  As a result, you do much better on your next test.
Later, some of your friends make fun of you for not going to the party.  (There will be others, right?)
Unfortunately, you have trouble trying to catch up with material you didn't understand, and as a result, you fail the next test as well.
You got lucky! Mr. Hinckley is a bit of a flake. He completely forgot about the help session he offered and went home right after school.
